textBox.richText: Member of the biometric team from 2006 to 2009 and now back from June 2015 to -- Scientific collaborator on mobile trustworthy face recognition. Involved in the project Google AS. Guillaume received a MSc. in Communication Systems and a Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering, both from EPFL in 2005 and 2010 respectively. As a PhD student, he was performing research in Face Recognition at Idiap Research Institute, and he also spent 6 months at Siemens Corporate Research, Princeton, where he worked on medical image analysis. After having graduated, he went to the Netherlands and worked as a R&D engineer at ViNotion, a small company providing custom solutions for video surveillance applications. In 2011, he joined SICPA Security Solutions, where he was in charge of research projects involving image processing, computer vision and machine learning. His current research interests are computer vision, machine learning and, on a broader perspective, the extraction of meaningful information from raw data.
